summary: This document is an email chain from August 1, 2019, between individuals at the Federal Bureau of Prisons discussing a request for notes on Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt. The correspondence shows internal communication about obtaining psychological records on Epstein shortly before his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; the request is for notes on his suicide attempt while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Request for Epstein's psychological notes
events.description: An initial request was made for notes on Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt.

events.title: Follow-up request for Epstein's notes
events.description: A follow-up email was sent urgently requesting notes on Epstein's suicide attempt, with a mention of needing HIPAA compliance.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons
keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 1, 2019, just days before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The subject is a request for psychological notes on Epstein's prior suicide attempt while in custody.
The correspondence involves personnel from the Federal Bureau of Prisons and references HIPAA compliance concerns.
The urgency of the request ('Please I need this asap') suggests internal interest in Epstein's mental state shortly before his death.
